column2: ME DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column4: Maine
column6: ME

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Drivers must signal anytime they pull away from the curb.
column4: True
column6: False

column2: 2. As you approach an intersection, the traffic light changes from green to yellow. You should:
column4: be prepared to stop in the middle of the intersection.
column6: apply the brakes sharply and come to a complete stop.
column8: speed up to beat the red light.
column10: be prepared to stop before the intersection.

column2: 3. When a pedestrian is crossing a street guided carrying a white cane, drivers must:
column4: yield the right of way at corners only.
column6: always yield the right-of-way.
column8: help the pedestrian cross the street.

column2: 4. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.
column6: Call an ambulance.
column8: Leave the road immediately.
column10: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.

column2: 5. If a vehicle using high beams comes toward you, look towards __________ of the road.
column4: the left side
column6: the center
column8: the right side

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop and yield right-of-way
column6: Slow down and yield to traffic on main road when merging
column8: Always come to a complete stop

column2: 7. The only effective way to reduce your blood alcohol content (BAC) is:
column4: drinking coffee.
column6: taking a cold shower.
column8: fresh air.
column10: not to drink over a period of time.

column2: 8. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Pull the steering wheel back.
column10: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 9. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: Drive with caution.
column6: The light will soon change from green to red.
column8: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.

column2: 10. Your blind spot is the area of the road:
column4: you cannot see without moving your head.
column6: directly behind your vehicle.
column8: you see in your rearview mirror.
column10: you see in your side mirror.

column2: 11. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.
column6: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
column8: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.

column2: 12. Anything that requires you to _______ could cause you to crash.
column4: take your eyes off the road
column6: take your attention away from driving
column8: take your hands off the wheel

column2: 13. If you have to wait for a space to enter a freeway, you should:
column4: slow down on the ramp and search ahead for a gap in traffic on the freeway.
column6: stop at the end of the ramp to wait for a gap in traffic.
column8: maintain speed and signal other drivers to make a gap.

column2: 14. Driving at night is more dangerous because:
column4: your reaction time is slower.
column6: you cannot see as far ahead at night.
column8: the road is more slippery.

column2: 15. Drivers should not sound their horn when:
column4: near blind pedestrians.
column6: visibility ahead is limited.
column8: they may hit another vehicle.

column2: 16. While driving, it is important to slow down:
column4: on narrow roads.
column6: when the road is wet.
column8: at intersections.

column2: 17. To reduce road rage, you should:
column4: use your horn frequently to warn other drivers.
column6: talk on your cell phone while driving.
column8: always signal your intention when changing lanes.

column2: 18. A flashing red light means:
column4: Go, but yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column6: Drive with caution.
column8: The light will soon change to steady red.
column10: The same as a STOP sign.

column2: 19. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column4: wear approved helmets.
column6: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.
column8: signal turns, lane changes and stops.

column2: 20. At an intersection without stop or yield signs, you should:
column4: yield to the vehicle to your left.
column6: wait until there are no vehicles at the intersection.
column8: yield to the vehicle to your right.

column2: 21. Drivers are required to stop:
column4: at an intersection with a stop sign.
column6: where there is a red light.
column8: when a traffic officer orders them to stop.

column2: 22. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column4: has the right-of-way.
column6: must enter the roadway immediately.
column8: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.
column10: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.

column2: 23. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs can:
column4: improves concentration.
column6: have a more pronounced effect than either taken separately.
column8: have a less pronounced effect than either taken separately.

column2: 24. Which of the following may result in an arrest for driving under the influence of intoxicants (DUII)?
column4: An inhalant, such as glue or paint.
column6: A controlled substance, such as prescription medicines or illegal drugs.
column8: Alcohol

column2: 25. When you come to an intersection with a flashing red light, you must:
column4: stop only if cars are approaching the intersection.
column6: stop at the intersection and wait for a flashing green light.
column8: slow down and drive carefully through the  intersection.
column10: stop at the intersection, then proceed when safe and observe the right-of-way rules.

column2: 26. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column6: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.
column8: wait for the next green light.
column10: enter the intersection and then stop.

column2: 27. Don't be afraid to sound a sharp blast on your horn when:
column4: another vehicle is in danger of hitting you.
column6: you have lost control of your vehicle and are moving towards someone.
column8: when a child is about to run into the street.

column2: 28. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column6: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.
column8: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.

column2: 29. This sign indicates:
column4: the entrance to a construction site.
column6: that you must not drive past this sign.
column8: that you must yield the right-of-way.
column10: the entrance to a dead-end street.

column2: 30. This road sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead
column6: Low ground railroad crossing
column8: No-passing zone

column2: 31. When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
column4: illegal to drink from, but permissible to transport, open containers of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column6: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.
column8: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column10: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.

column2: 32. A steady green light at intersections means:
column4: You must stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding
column6: You must increase your speed
column8: You may not turn right
column10: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear

column2: 33. When driving in work zones, drivers should:
column4: pass the vehicle ahead when safe.
column6: keep a safe following distance.
column8: tailgate the vehicle ahead while reducing their speed.

column2: 34. If the driver of an oncoming vehicle fails to dim the lights, you should look:
column4: toward the right side of the road.
column6: toward the center of the roadway.
column8: straight ahead.

column2: 35. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: You are driving in the wrong direction. Make a U-turn as soon as possible.
column6: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.
column8: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column10: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.

column2: 36. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.
column6: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.
column8: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column10: The effects of alcohol are reduced by the drug.

column2: 37. The basic color for traffic control devices used in construction zones is:
column4: orange.
column6: red.
column8: yellow.

column2: 38. Regulatory signs:
column4: warn drivers about road hazards.
column6: provide information about the road rules and traffic laws.
column8: regulate the flow of traffic at school zone.
column10: are diamond shaped and yellow or green.

column2: 39. Highway hypnosis is a driving condition that can result from:
column4: frequent rest stops.
column6: travelling on HOV lanes.
column8: staring at the roadway for long periods of time.

column2: 40. When you see this sign you should:
column4: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.
column6: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
column8: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column10: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.

column2: 41. This road sign means:
column4: Bicycles are not allowed in this area
column6: Bicycle parking ahead
column8: Watch for bicycles

column2: 42. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column6: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column8: make a U-turn and return to the expressway.
column10: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.

column2: 43. You are driving at night, and a vehicle comes toward you with their high beam headlights on. You should:
column4: look in the direction of the vehicle.
column6: keep your high beams on.
column8: flash your headlights once quickly.

column2: 44. If you see orange construction signs and cones on a freeway, you must:
column4: be prepared for workers and equipment ahead.
column6: maintain your current speed while changing lanes.
column8: make a U-turn because the lane ends ahead.

column2: 45. This road sign means:
column4: Bicycles have the right-of-way
column6: This lane is reserved for bicyclists
column8: Bicycle crossing

column2: 46. When passing other vehicles, drivers should:
column4: apply the brake and slow down.
column6: make sure the passing lane is clear of traffic, and check behind and to the left to make sure another vehicle is not attempting to pass.
column8: pass the vehicle as slowly as possible.

column2: 47. This road sign means:
column4: Traffic must move only in the direction of the arrow
column6: Two way Traffic
column8: Two way left turn

column2: 48. Large trucks:
column4: can stop quicker than passenger vehicles.
column6: have large blind spots.
column8: do not need more room to maneuver.

column2: 49. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
column4: Before you decrease speed and reach the intersection.
column6: If traffic conditions require it.
column8: Never.

column2: 50. To avoid panic stops, you should:
column4: scan the road ahead for hazards.
column6: pump your brakes to make sure they work.
column8: drive with your window down.

column2: 51. When driving in snow, you should:
column4: make speed and directional changes more gradually.
column6: slowly increase your speed for better traction.
column8: use your cruise control if possible.

column2: 52. Two solid yellow lines on the pavement mean:
column4: passing is allowed if you are at the top of a hill.
column6: passing is allowed during daylight only.
column8: passing is not allowed.
column10: passing is allowed for both drivers.

column2: 53. When a traffic signal light turns green, you should:
column4: wait 5 seconds before proceeding.
column6: yield the right-of-way to larger vehicles.
column8: back up slowly.

column2: 54. When another vehicle is passing you:
column4: stay in your lane and reduce speed.
column6: stay in your lane and maintain speed unless there is an emergency.
column8: pull your vehicle as far to the right as possible without leaving the pavement.

column2: 55. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column4: riding the pedal lightly.
column6: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.
column8: having them checked by a mechanic.

column2: 56. This sign is used to warn drivers about:
column4: drowsy driving.
column6: changes in traffic lanes.
column8: road construction.

column2: 57. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column4: that a tire blowout is about to occur.
column6: of a headlight failure.
column8: of a brake failure.

column2: 58. This road sign means:
column4: Steep downgrade
column6: Slippery when wet
column8: Low shoulder

column2: 59. Before you change lanes, you should:
column4: look for other traffic by turning your head and looking behind you for oncoming traffic.
column6: keep other vehicles out of your blind spots.
column8: check your left mirror.

column2: 60. In 55 MPH traffic you are least likely to be involved in a collision if you:
column4: stay within that speed range.
column6: drive a few MPH slower than most.
column8: drive a few MPH faster than most.
